content.question: At time <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, a rocket in outer space has mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math>, speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>, and the magnitude of the rocket’s momentum is <math alttext="p sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>p</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. The rocket’s engines eject fuel, and the mass of the rocket decreases. At a later time <math alttext="t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, the rocket has mass <math alttext="the fraction m over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>, speed <math alttext="2 v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>v</mi></math>, and the magnitude of the rocket’s momentum is <math alttext="p sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>p</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. Which of the following correctly relates <math alttext="p sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>p</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="p sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>p</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>?
